  "description": "FMR Agency is an End to end HR Company in Nigeria placing quality candidates to quality Companies alongside other services. This time, our client in the Real Estate industry is looking for a well experienced and competent Sales Representative.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Pharmacist
Job Location:&nbsp;Gbagada, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time
Working Hours: 8 am - 9 pm (on alternate shifts)

Role Description


	We are seeking an experienced and licensed pharmacist to oversee the professional and operational activities of our neighbourhood pharmacy &amp; supermarket.
	The ideal candidate will be responsible for ensuring regulatory compliance, dispensing medications accurately, providing quality pharmaceutical care, supervising pharmacy staff, and supporting the overall business growth of the pharmacy.
	He/she must be patient-focused and remain up-to-date with the latest advances in pharmaceutical science.


Responsibilities


	Dispense prescription and over-the-counter (OTC) medications accurately and efficiently.
	Provide medication counselling, drug information, and health advice to patients.
	Providing medical services, such as taking blood pressure, temperature measurements, and checking blood sugar levels.
	Ensure compliance with all regulatory requirements of the Pharmacists Council of Nigeria (PCN), NAFDAC, and other relevant authorities.
	Maintain accurate patient medication records and pharmacy documentation.
	Supervise and train pharmacy technicians, interns, and other support staff.
	Monitor inventory levels, check for expiries, and ensure proper storage of drugs.
	Participate in community health outreach, patient education, and wellness programs.
	Support business operations by promoting pharmaceutical services and ensuring excellent customer experience.
	Prepare and submit periodic reports as required by regulatory bodies and management.
	Patient clerking and recommendations
	Monitoring customers&rsquo; drug therapies, advising interventions, and counseling on any potential side effects.
	Completing operational requirements of the pharmacy, including verifying order entries, maintaining records of controlled substances, charges, and removing expired and/or damaged drugs from the pharmacy&rsquo;s inventory.
	Adhering to applicable legal rules, regulations, and procedures governing pharmaceutical practice.
	Additional duties as needed from a pharmacist.


Key Requirements


	Bachelor of Pharmacy (B.Pharm) or Doctor of Pharmacy (Pharm.D).
	Minimum of 2-5 years of post-NYSC experience in community or retail pharmacy practice.
	Current license to practice as a Pharmacist in Nigeria (PCN registration).
	Strong knowledge of drugs, pharmaceutical care, and regulatory compliance.
	Excellent communication, counselling, and customer service skills.
	Ability to supervise and motivate staff.
	Proficiency in pharmacy software and basic IT tools is an added advantage.


Salary
N250,000 - N350,000 monthly.

Method of Application&nbsp;
Interested and qualified&nbsp;candidates should send their CV to:&nbsp;recruiter.u@fmragency.com&nbsp;using Job Position as the subject of the email.",

Pharmacist Job at FMR Agency




        
    

        
        FMR Agency is an End to end HR Company in Nigeria placing quality candidates to quality Companies alongside other services. This time, our client in the Real Estate industry is looking for a well experienced and competent Sales Representative.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Pharmacist
Job Location: Gbagada, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time
Working Hours: 8 am - 9 pm (on alternate shifts)

Role Description
     

            
    




	We are seeking an experienced and licensed pharmacist to oversee the professional and operational activities of our neighbourhood pharmacy & supermarket.
	The ideal candidate will be responsible for ensuring regulatory compliance, dispensing medications accurately, providing quality pharmaceutical care, supervising pharmacy staff, and supporting the overall business growth of the pharmacy.
	He/she must be patient-focused and remain up-to-date with the latest advances in pharmaceutical science.


Responsibilities


	Dispense prescription and over-the-counter (OTC) medications accurately and efficiently.
	Provide medication counselling, drug information, and health advice to patients.
	Providing medical services, such as taking blood pressure, temperature measurements, and checking blood sugar levels.
	Ensure compliance with all regulatory requirements of the Pharmacists Council of Nigeria (PCN), NAFDAC, and other relevant authorities.
	Maintain accurate patient medication records and pharmacy documentation.
	Supervise and train pharmacy technicians, interns, and other support staff.
	Monitor inventory levels, check for expiries, and ensure proper storage of drugs.
	Participate in community health outreach, patient education, and wellness programs.
	Support business operations by promoting pharmaceutical services and ensuring excellent customer experience.
	Prepare and submit periodic reports as required by regulatory bodies and management.
	Patient clerking and recommendations
	Monitoring customers’ drug therapies, advising interventions, and counseling on any potential side effects.
	Completing operational requirements of the pharmacy, including verifying order entries, maintaining records of controlled substances, charges, and removing expired and/or damaged drugs from the pharmacy’s inventory.
	Adhering to applicable legal rules, regulations, and procedures governing pharmaceutical practice.
	Additional duties as needed from a pharmacist.


Key Requirements


	Bachelor of Pharmacy (B.Pharm) or Doctor of Pharmacy (Pharm.D).
	Minimum of 2-5 years of post-NYSC experience in community or retail pharmacy practice.
	Current license to practice as a Pharmacist in Nigeria (PCN registration).
	Strong knowledge of drugs, pharmaceutical care, and regulatory compliance.
	Excellent communication, counselling, and customer service skills.
	Ability to supervise and motivate staff.
	Proficiency in pharmacy software and basic IT tools is an added advantage.


Salary
N250,000 - N350,000 monthly.

Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: [email protected] using Job Position as the subject of the email.

Management Accountant Job at PPC Limited




        
    

        
        PPC Limited, we turn ideas into solutions and help businesses to create and implement exceptional user experiences. We are specialized systems integrator.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Management Accountant

Job Location: Victoria Island, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Purpose
     

            
    




	Provide all Financial and Accounting activities required to secure an effective operations of the Organisation.
	Will manage, direct and develop all Accounting and Finance Staff and ensure the team is at the forefront of growing the business.


Job Responsibilities
Key Result Area 1- Systems Management & Operations:


	Preparing timely management and financial accounts and accurate preparation of monthly management accounts
	Undertaking all day to day financial transactions and credit control functions
	Preparation of monthly management accounts for the business unit
	Assisting the GM Financial Reporting with the preparation of consolidated group financial statements and all year end work
	Preparing yearly budgets and undertaking quarterly/monthly/weekly performance reviews thereof
	Upgrading financial processes and systems
	Leading the Audit of the Centre
	Financial forecasts and analysis for each potential Centre, as part of PPC’s growth Agenda
	Close liaison with the GM Financial Reporting to resolve all issues
	Involvement in cash planning, monitoring and control
	Any other Ad hoc duties as directed by Management.


Requirements


	Education: B.Sc
	Experience: At least 10 years of experience with at least 3 in a similar role
	Professional Qualification: ACA, ACCA, CIMA.


Technical:


	Highly numeric/strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
	Advanced level spreadsheet skills and PC literacy.
	Strong accounting and book-keeping skills.


Behavioural:


	Experience of staff Management.
	Confident communication skills and strong report writing skills.
	Drive to continually improve processes and seek new challenges.
	Ability to work well under pressure, working accurately with attention to detail, and meeting deadlines.


Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: [email protected] using the Job Posiiton as the subject of the email.

  "description": "Greenlight Planet is a multinational, for-profit business that designs, distributes, and finances solar-powered home energy products, with an underserved population in mind: the 1.3 billion global consumers for whom the old-fashioned electrical grid is either unavailable or too expensive.

Over a decade in business, the company is now a leading global brand in emerging markets across Asia and Sub-Saharan Africa.&nbsp; Greenlight&rsquo;s Sun King&trade; products provide modern light and energy to 26 million people in more than 40 countries and have sold over 10.5 million products worldwide.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position:&nbsp;Sun King Store Executive

Job Location:&nbsp;Kontagora, Niger
Employment Type: Permanent - Full Time
Workplace type:&nbsp;Onsite
Department: EasyBuy Direct Sales
Reporting to:&nbsp;Regional Business Manager, North Central

About the Role
The team you would join:


	The Sun King Store Executive will ensure that the overall performance targets of the store are met both in terms of quality and quantity


Responsibilities
Inventory management:


	Receive stock and keep track of inventory from warehouse
	Manage and issue out stock as per FIFO standards
	Dispatch stocks as per requirement
